description.plain:
Danielle Peskowitz Bregoli (b. March 26, 2003), better known by her stage name Bhad Bhabie, is a rapper and internet personality from Boynton Beach, Florida. She initially rose to fame with her catchphrase “catch me outside” and was boosted by Suede the Remix God’s remix of it.

She continued her foray into the music world by appearing in music videos for the likes of Kodak Black, but didn’t release her first single “These Heaux” until August 2017, more than six months after she initially blew up. However, the single did well, reaching #1 on some Spotify charts and #77 on the Billboard Hot 100.

After the success of “These Heaux,” it was announced that Bhad Bhabie had signed a multi-million record deal with Atlantic Records (Ed Sheeran, Paramore, Sia, Kehlani, Kodak Black).

The label then released a double-feature of singles, “Hi Bich” and “Whachu Know”, with the former reaching #68 on the Billboard Hot 100. Later, in November, the single “I Got It” was issued, followed in December by “Mama Don’t Worry (Still Ain’t Dirty)”. More singles were released afterward, and she eventually released a collaboration with Lil Yachty. That song, “Gucci Flip Flops,” entered the Billboard Hot 100 at #80.

Danielle Peskowitz Bregoli (b. March 26, 2003), better known by her stage name Bhad Bhabie, is a rapper and internet personality from Boynton Beach, Florida. She initially rose to fame with her catchphrase “catch me outside” and was boosted by Suede the Remix God’s remix of it.

She continued her foray into the music world by appearing in music videos for the likes of Kodak Black, but didn’t release her first single “These Heaux” until August 2017, more than six months after she initially blew up. However, the single did well, reaching #1 on some Spotify charts and #77 on the Billboard Hot 100.

After the success of “These Heaux,” it was announced that Bhad Bhabie had signed a multi-million record deal with Atlantic Records (Ed Sheeran, Paramore, Sia, Kehlani, Kodak Black).

The label then released a double-feature of singles, “Hi Bich” and “Whachu Know”, with the former reaching #68 on the Billboard Hot 100. Later, in November, the single “I Got It” was issued, followed in December by “Mama Don’t Worry (Still Ain’t Dirty)”. More singles were released afterward, and she eventually released a collaboration with Lil Yachty. That song, “Gucci Flip Flops,” entered the Billboard Hot 100 at #80.

songs.full_title: Gucci Flip Flops by Bhad Bhabie (Ft. Lil Yachty)
songs.title: Gucci Flip Flops

description.plain:
“Gucci Flip Flops” marks the first collaboration between Lil Yachty and Bhad Bhabie. However, Bhad Bhabie appeared as a surprise cameo for the music video of Yachty’s single “COUNT ME IN” which released on the 22nd of March 2018

“Gucci Flip Flops” samples “The Devil Speaks” made by PRXJEK, which was sampled previously in “Costa Rica” by Ronny J and featured Ski Mask the Slump God.

In “Gucci Flip Flops”, Bhabie and Yachty rap about Gucci Flip Flops, jewelry, and their exorbitant wealth.

songs.title: Hi Bich

description.plain:
Bhabie returned on the hip-hop scene with a new track, produced by Ronny J, titled “Hi Bich/Whatchu Know” and the accompanying visual, shrugging off the backlash that’s been hurled her way in recent months.

Bhad Bhabie went from viral Internet star to budding rapper and with a new record deal with Atlantic Records,  After dropping off her debut single “These Heaux” in August 2017.

songs.embed_content: Read “Hi Bich” by Bhad Bhabie on Genius

songs.title: These Heaux

description.plain:
In this song, fourteen year old Danielle, known from her appearance on Dr. Phil, raps about being fed up with “these hoes”.  She goes on to state that she is nothing like them and should not be compared to them.  She also raps about the things that disgust her about “these hoes”.

Days later after the song was released, Danielle signed a multi-record deal, under her rap name “Bhad Bhabie,” with Atlantic Records.
